decks.notes: The Ruby Storm deck focuses on generating large amounts of mana quickly through rituals and mana-generating spells, while also utilizing Ral, Monsoon Mage's abilities to deal damage and draw cards. The deck aims to cast a high storm count spell like Grapeshot to deal massive damage to the opponent in one turn. The inclusion of Past in Flames allows the player to reuse spells from the graveyard, and Wrenn's Resolve helps with card selection and potentially shuffling the library for a better draw. Overall, the deck seeks to create explosive turns and overwhelm the opponent with its combo potential.

The key concept of this deck is to utilize cards like Unearth, Persist, and Faithless Looting to quickly fill up the graveyard with powerful creatures, such as Emperor of Bones and Archon of Cruelty. By combining reanimation spells with disruptive cards like Thoughtseize and Spell Pierce, the deck aims to overwhelm opponents with early threats and disrupt their game plan. The inclusion of Psychic Frog and Abhorrent Oculus provides additional value and control elements, making it a versatile and deadly combo-reanimator deck in Modern 1 vs 1 format.

This deck focuses on assembling the Amulet Titan combo as quickly and efficiently as possible. By utilizing cards like Amulet of Vigor and Primeval Titan, the deck aims to ramp up its mana quickly and utilize powerful lands like Urza's Saga and Vesuva to generate immense value. Through the use of cards like Scapeshift and Summoner's Pact, the deck can search for key combo pieces and overwhelming the opponent with massive creatures and powerful land synergies. The deck also includes disruption elements like Malevolent Rumble to control the board and protect its combo.

This deck aims to quickly reanimate powerful creatures like Griselbrand by using cards like Goryo's Vengeance and Ephemerate. The deck also includes disruptive elements like Force of Negation and Thoughtseize to protect the combo pieces. Quantum Riddler and Psychic Frog provide additional card advantage and control options. Faithful Mending helps with card selection and graveyard filling. The deck utilizes a mix of lands for color fixing and flexibility. Overall, the strategy revolves around setting up a powerful reanimation combo while disrupting the opponent's plans.

This deck focuses on aggressive creature plays and burn spells to quickly overwhelm the opponent and deal damage as quickly as possible. It also incorporates cards that provide additional support for the aggressive strategy, such as Leyline of the Guildpact to boost the power of multicolored creatures and Stubborn Denial for protection. The deck aims to establish early board presence and maintain pressure throughout the game, utilizing a combination of efficient creatures and removal spells to disrupt the opponent's strategy and secure a victory.

This deck focuses on utilizing artifacts with low casting costs to quickly build a board presence and overwhelm the opponent with efficient attacks. By combining cards that provide mana acceleration like Mox Opal and Springleaf Drum with powerful artifact creatures like Ornithopter and Memnite, the deck aims to quickly deploy threats and close out the game before the opponent can establish their own game plan. Additionally, the inclusion of cards like Cranial Plating and Thought Monitor provide additional ways to enhance the deck's aggro strategy and push for a swift victory.

This deck focuses on assembling the Amulet Titan combo by utilizing cards like Amulet of Vigor and Primeval Titan to generate a powerful board state quickly. The goal is to ramp up mana production and utilize lands like Urza's Saga and Valakut, the Molten Pinnacle to deal massive amounts of damage to the opponent. The deck also includes cards like Dryad of the Ilysian Grove and Aftermath Analyst to provide additional synergy and options for manipulating the board. The strategy revolves around efficiently tutoring for and playing key combo pieces to overwhelm the opponent and secure victory.

The focus of this deck is to control the game by utilizing counterspells, removal, and card advantage to outlast the opponent. The deck aims to slow down the opponent's strategy with cards like Teferi, Time Raveler and Orim's Chant, while also maintaining card advantage with cards like Tune the Narrative and Snapcaster Mage. The win condition is to establish board control and eventually use powerful finishers like Quantum Riddler and Wrath of the Skies to close out the game. The deck also includes lands that provide flexibility and consistency in mana production.

The deck focuses on assembling the Tron lands (Urza's Tower, Power Plant, and Mine) to generate a significant amount of mana quickly. It then utilizes powerful Eldrazi creatures and colorless spells to control the board and disrupt the opponent's game plan. Karn, the Great Creator is a key card that can shut down artifacts and activate powerful abilities, while Thought-Knot Seer provides disruption by exiling cards from the opponent's hand. The deck aims to establish a dominant board presence and overpower the opponent through its mana advantage and powerful threats.

The deck focuses on assembling the Amulet Titan combo by ramping up quickly with cards like Arboreal Grazer, Crumbling Vestige, and Primeval Titan. By utilizing Amulet of Vigor and Simic Growth Chamber, players can generate large amounts of mana to play their powerful threats like Primeval Titan and Urza's Saga. The deck also includes utility lands like Vesuva and Boseiju, Who Endures to help deal with specific situations. Overall, the key strategy of the deck is to quickly assemble the combo pieces and overwhelm the opponent with powerful creatures and lands.

The main concept of this deck is to disrupt your opponent's game plan while applying pressure with aggressive creatures. By utilizing cards like Thoughtseize to strip away key cards from your opponent's hand and Ephemerate to blink your creatures for additional value, you can control the game while chipping away at your opponent's life total. The deck focuses on a mix of disruptive elements and aggressive threats to keep your opponent on the back foot and secure victory through a combination of tempo advantage and overwhelming board presence.

The key concept of this deck is to overwhelm the opponent with a fast and aggressive playstyle using efficient creatures like Dragon's Rage Channeler, Slickshot Show-Off, and Monastery Swiftspear, supported by cheap burn spells such as Lightning Bolt and Lava Dart. The deck also utilizes cantrips like Preordain and Mishra's Bauble to dig for more threats and keep the pressure on. The goal is to quickly reduce the opponent's life total while maintaining card advantage through card filtering and efficient removal spells.

This deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a fast and aggressive strategy, utilizing creatures like Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer and Seasoned Pyromancer to apply pressure early on. It also includes powerful spells like Thoughtseize and Fatal Push to disrupt the opponent's game plan. The deck also has access to cards like Goblin Bombardment and Ajani, Nacatl Pariah to close out the game quickly. The mana base is carefully crafted to support the aggressive game plan, with fetch lands and dual lands to ensure consistency in casting spells.

This deck focuses on aggressive plays using a combination of powerful creatures and efficient spells to quickly overwhelm the opponent. By utilizing Leyline cards to boost the effectiveness of multicolored spells, along with cards like Lightning Bolt for removal and Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer for early damage, this deck aims to establish a strong board presence and control the game tempo. With a mix of land fetch cards and versatile creatures like Territorial Kavu and Scion of Draco, this deck can adapt to various situations and apply pressure consistently.

This deck focuses on aggressive gameplay, utilizing powerful creatures like Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer, Territorial Kavu, and Scion of Draco to quickly overwhelm the opponent. The deck includes various removal spells like Lightning Bolt and Leyline Binding to control the board and ensure the opponent's creatures don't get in the way of the aggro strategy. The use of Leyline of the Guildpact and Fable of the Mirror-Breaker enhances the deck's synergy and consistency, while Stubborn Denial provides protection against removal spells. Overall, the deck aims to apply continuous pressure and finish the game quickly.

This deck focuses on utilizing efficient removal and disruptive spells to control the opponent's hand and board while deploying aggressive creatures to quickly close out the game. The inclusion of Eldrazi creatures like Thought-Knot Seer and Emperor of Bones provides additional disruption and power to overwhelm the opponent. With a mix of hand disruption, creature removal, and powerful threats, this Mono Black Aggro deck aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan and apply constant pressure to secure victory.
